```{r knitr, include = FALSE}
DOCNAME = knitr::current_input()
DOCNAME = gsub(DOCNAME, pattern = ".Rmd", replacement = "", fixed = T)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(autodep        = TRUE,
                      cache          = FALSE,
                      echo           = TRUE,
                      error          = FALSE,
                      fig.align      = "center",
                      fig.path       = paste0("./images/", DOCNAME, "/"),
                      message        = FALSE,
                      warning        = FALSE,
                      eval           = FALSE)
```

# Rmarkdown example

:::{.callout-note title="overview"}

This is an example of how to make md pages from rmarkdown documents. The source code to generate this md document is in `develop/rmd/rmarkdown_example.Rmd`.
:::

First we need to write the document as usual. Try to use the admonitions as in previous examples. Citations are like this [@Garcia2020].

## Writing code

You can run code as usual in Rmarkdown. The chunk options can be very useful. 
By default, the code will not run unless explicity specified in the chunk (you can change this behaviour on the "knitr" chunk above).

```{r, eval = TRUE}
library(tidyverse)
```


```{r ggplot, eval = TRUE}
#| label: fig-charts
#| fig-cap: "Charts"
ggplot(data = txhousing, aes(x = sales, y = listings)) +
  geom_point()
```

## Adding images

You can add images using the `knitr::include_graphics()` option.

```{r, echo = TRUE, eval = TRUE, out.width="50%"}

knitr::include_graphics("../img/logo.png")
```
